answers.answer: Human trafficking is a form of modern slavery and human rights violations that involves the recruitment, transportation, transfer, harbouring or receipt of persons by means of threats, use of force, or psychological pressure for exploitation.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/human-trafficking and read the section under 'What is human trafficking?'.

answers.answer: Exploitation can take forms such as labour exploitation, sexual exploitation, involvement in criminal activities, forced begging, domestic servitude, illegal adoption, organ removal, slavery, or forced marriage.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/human-trafficking and read the section under 'What is human trafficking?'.

answers.answer: Human trafficking can be reported via TELVERDE ANITIP at 0800.800.678 (in Romania) or the eLiberare Crisis Textline at 0757.749.845. Other options include the Romanian National Anti-trafficking Helpline, National Emergency Number 112, the 527 hotline for migrants, or seeking help in a public place.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/human-trafficking and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: Signs of exploitation include being offered an unrealistically high salary, being forced to work or perform services/sex without consent, withholding of documents or communication devices, strict rules, restricted movement, forced debt repayment, or non-payment/underpayment for work.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/human-trafficking and read the section under 'Signs which may indicate you are or could be exploited by a person claiming to help you'.

answers.answer: Vulnerability can be limited by knowing your rights, maintaining possession of documents, keeping in touch with trusted people, gathering information about travel plans and sharing it, and developing a secret 'safeword'.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/human-trafficking and read the section under 'What can you do to limit your vulnerability to trafficking?'.

answers.answer: Sexual exploitation is any actual or attempted abuse of a position of vulnerability, differential power, or trust for sexual purposes.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/human-trafficking and read the section under 'What is sexual exploitation?'.

answers.answer: Suspected sexual exploitation and abuse by a UNHCR, UN, or NGO staff member can be reported directly to UNHCR Romania at inspector@unhcr.org, including details of what happened, who committed it, and when/where it occurred.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/human-trafficking and read the section under 'Report suspected sexual exploitation and abuse'.

answers.answer: The provided content mentions tips on what to put in a child's safety backpack but does not list the specific items.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/human-trafficking and read the section under 'Children’s security'.

answers.answer: Parents can prepare children for safety by providing tips for a safety backpack, discussing important points to minimize stress, and creating a plan of action for different occasions.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/human-trafficking and read the section under 'Children’s security'.

answers.answer: The eLiberare guide for children is a story created by the eLiberare Association with UNICEF to serve as a conversation guide between parents and children of all ages, covering basic safeguards against human trafficking and online exploitation.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/human-trafficking and read the section under 'A guide helping Children of all ages avoid human traffickers'.

answers.answer: National anti-trafficking hotlines can be called if you find yourself in a situation of exploitation.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/human-trafficking and read the section under 'Suggestions to seek help'.

answers.answer: Emergency help can be accessed by calling the Romanian National Anti-trafficking Helpline, the National Emergency Number 112, or the free national anti-trafficking hotline for migrants, or by going to a public place like a hospital or post office.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/human-trafficking and read the section under 'Suggestions to seek help'.

answers.answer: Sprijin de Urgență provides resources such as food, products, clothing, tents, transportation, or volunteers, and allows users to request or offer these items.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/human-trafficking and read the section under 'Sprijin de Urgență'.

answers.answer: Un Acoperiș helps by providing support in finding temporary accommodation or by allowing individuals to offer a space to help vulnerable people coming to Romania.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/human-trafficking and read the section under 'Un Acoperiș'.
